description: The Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture houses one of the world's leading collections documenting the African diaspora. Digital collections include rare books, manuscripts, photographs, moving images, and audio recordings spanning five centuries. Notable collections include the Jean Blackwell Hutson Research and Reference Division, the Photographs and Prints Division, and the Moving Image and Recorded Sound Division. Materials cover African American history, Pan-African movements, the Harlem Renaissance, and contemporary Black culture.
